content:
TITLE: Basic Google Sheets Operations with gspread
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates core gspread functionality including authentication, opening a spreadsheet, updating cell ranges and single cells, and applying cell formatting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

gc = gspread.service_account()

# Open a sheet from a spreadsheet in one go
wks = gc.open("Where is the money Lebowski?").sheet1

# Update a range of cells using the top left corner address
wks.update([[1, 2], [3, 4]], 'A1')

# Or update a single cell
wks.update_acell('B42', "it's down there somewhere, let me take another look.")

# Format the header
wks.format('A1:B1', {'textFormat': {'bold': True}})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Google Sheets Operations
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates core operations including authentication, opening a spreadsheet, updating cells and formatting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

# First you need access to the Google API. Based on the route you
# chose in Step 1, call either service_account(), oauth() or api_key().
gc = gspread.service_account()

# Open a sheet from a spreadsheet in one go
wks = gc.open("Where is the money Lebowski?").sheet1

# Update a range of cells using the top left corner address
wks.update([[1, 2], [3, 4]], "A1")

# Or update a single cell
wks.update_acell("B42", "it's down there somewhere, let me take another look.")

# Format the header
wks.format('A1:B1', {'textFormat': {'bold': True}})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Writing pandas DataFrame to Google Sheets with gspread
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to update a worksheet with pandas DataFrame data, including the column headers. The update() method is used to write both the column names and values to the sheet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import pandas as pd

worksheet.update([dataframe.columns.values.tolist()] + dataframe.values.tolist())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authenticating with Service Account in Python using gspread
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to authenticate with Google Sheets API using a service account. It loads the service account credentials from the default location and opens a spreadsheet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

gc = gspread.service_account()

sh = gc.open("Example spreadsheet")

print(sh.sheet1.get('A1'))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Google Sheets Data to pandas DataFrame with gspread
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import worksheet data into a pandas DataFrame using the get_all_records() method. This is useful for performing data analysis on Google Sheets data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import pandas as pd

dataframe = pd.DataFrame(worksheet.get_all_records())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Writing NumPy Array to Google Sheets with gspread
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to update a worksheet with data from a NumPy array. The example creates a 2D array and writes it to the worksheet starting from cell A2 using the update() method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import numpy as np

array = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])

# Write the array to worksheet starting from the A2 cell
worksheet.update(array.tolist(), 'A2')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Sharing Spreadsheets
DESCRIPTION: Examples of creating new spreadsheets and managing sharing permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh = gc.create('A new spreadsheet')

# But that new spreadsheet will be visible only to your script's account.
# To be able to access newly created spreadsheet you *must* share it
# with your email. Which brings us to…
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh.share('otto@example.com', perm_type='user', role='writer')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom Authentication Using Authlib with gspread
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use Authlib for custom authentication with gspread. It creates an AssertionSession using a configuration file and uses it to authenticate gspread. The code also demonstrates opening a spreadsheet, updating a cell, and fetching a cell range.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/advanced.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import json
from gspread import Client
from authlib.integrations.requests_client import AssertionSession

def create_assertion_session(conf_file, scopes, subject=None):
    with open(conf_file, 'r') as f:
        conf = json.load(f)

    token_url = conf['token_uri']
    issuer = conf['client_email']
    key = conf['private_key']
    key_id = conf.get('private_key_id')

    header = {'alg': 'RS256'}
    if key_id:
        header['kid'] = key_id

    # Google puts scope in payload
    claims = {'scope': ' '.join(scopes)}
    return AssertionSession(
        grant_type=AssertionSession.JWT_BEARER_GRANT_TYPE,
        token_endpoint=token_url,
        issuer=issuer,
        audience=token_url,
        claims=claims,
        subject=subject,
        key=key,
        header=header,
    )

scopes = [
    'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets',
    'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive',
]
session = create_assertion_session('your-google-conf.json', scopes)
gc = Client(None, session)

wks = gc.open("Where is the money Lebowski?").sheet1

wks.update_acell('B2', "it's down there somewhere, let me take another look.")

# Fetch a cell range
cell_list = wks.range('A1:B7')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OAuth Authentication from Dictionary in Python using gspread
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to authenticate using OAuth by providing the credentials as a Python dictionary rather than loading from a file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

credentials = {
    "installed": {
        "client_id": "12345678901234567890abcdefghijklmn.apps.googleusercontent.com",
        "project_id": "my-project1234",
        "auth_uri": "https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/auth",
        "token_uri": "https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token",
        ...
    }
}
gc, authorized_user = gspread.oauth_from_dict(credentials)

sh = gc.open("Example spreadsheet")

print(sh.sheet1.get('A1'))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OAuth Authentication in Python using gspread
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to authenticate with Google Sheets API using OAuth. It launches a browser for user authentication and stores credentials for future use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

gc = gspread.oauth()

sh = gc.open("Example spreadsheet")

print(sh.sheet1.get('A1'))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Google Sheets Data to NumPy Array with gspread
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates reading worksheet data into a NumPy array. The example shows how to handle all values from a sheet, with a note about skipping header rows if necessary.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import numpy as np
array = np.array(worksheet.get_all_values())
```

TITLE: Creating and Sharing Spreadsheets
DESCRIPTION: Creating a new spreadsheet and sharing it with other users with specific permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh = gc.create('A new spreadsheet')
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh.share('otto@example.com', perm_type='user', role='writer')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Advanced Cell Formatting in Google Sheets with gspread
DESCRIPTION: Applies multiple formatting options to cells A2:B2 including background color, horizontal alignment, text color and font size. This demonstrates how to use complex formatting objects with the worksheet.format() method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
worksheet.format("A2:B2", {
    "backgroundColor": {
      "red": 0.0,
      "green": 0.0,
      "blue": 0.0
    },
    "horizontalAlignment": "CENTER",
    "textFormat": {
      "foregroundColor": {
        "red": 1.0,
        "green": 1.0,
        "blue": 1.0
      },
      "fontSize": 12,
      "bold": True
    }
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Data Validation Rules
DESCRIPTION: Adding data validation rules to cells including number validation and dropdown lists.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
ws.add_validation(
   'A1',
   ValidationConditionType.number_greater,
   [10],
   strict=True,
   inputMessage='Value must be greater than 10'
)
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
worksheet.add_validation(
   'C2:C7',
   ValidationConditionType.one_of_list,
   ['Yes',
   'No',],
   showCustomUi=True
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing a Spreadsheet with Regular Authentication in Python
DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to open a spreadsheet by name and access cell data using standard authentication credentials. This method requires proper authorization setup and works with both private and public spreadsheets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh = gc.open("Example spreadsheet")

print(sh.sheet1.get('A1'))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cell Operations and Data Validation
DESCRIPTION: Examples of reading, updating cells and adding data validation rules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread
from gspread.utils import ValidationConditionType

# Restrict the input to greater than 10 in a single cell
worksheet.add_validation(
  'A1',
  ValidationConditionType.number_greater,
  [10],
  strict=True,
  inputMessage='Value must be greater than 10',
)

# Restrict the input to Yes/No for a specific range with dropdown
worksheet.add_validation(
  'C2:C7',
   ValidationConditionType.one_of_list,
   ['Yes',
   'No',]
   showCustomUi=True
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Service Account Authentication with Custom Path in Python using gspread
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to authenticate with a service account by specifying a custom path to the credentials file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
gc = gspread.service_account(filename='path/to/the/downloaded/file.json')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cell Operations and Value Retrieval
DESCRIPTION: Methods for getting and updating cell values, including formatted and unformatted values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
val = worksheet.acell('B1').value

val = worksheet.cell(1, 2).value

cell = worksheet.acell('B1', value_render_option='FORMULA').value
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from gspread.utils import ValueRenderOption
worksheet.get("A1:B2", value_render_option=ValueRenderOption.unformatted)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Opening Spreadsheets
DESCRIPTION: Shows different methods to open Google Sheets by title, key, or URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# You can open a spreadsheet by its title as it appears in Google Docs
sh = gc.open('My poor gym results') # <-- Look ma, no keys!

# If you want to be specific, use a key (which can be extracted from
# the spreadsheet's url)
sht1 = gc.open_by_key('0BmgG6nO_6dprdS1MN3d3MkdPa142WFRrdnRRUWl1UFE')

# Or, if you feel really lazy to extract that key, paste the entire url
sht2 = gc.open_by_url('https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Bm...FE&hl')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OAuth Authentication with Stored Authorized User in Python using gspread
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to authenticate with OAuth using both credentials and previously authorized user information, which can bypass the authentication flow if the tokens haven't expired.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

credentials = {
    "installed": {
        "client_id": "12345678901234567890abcdefghijklmn.apps.googleusercontent.com",
        "project_id": "my-project1234",
        "auth_uri": "https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/auth",
        "token_uri": "https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token",
        ...
    }
}
authorized_user = {
    "refresh_token": "8//ThisALONGTOkEn....",
    "token_uri": "https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token",
    "client_id": "12345678901234567890abcdefghijklmn.apps.googleusercontent.com",
    "client_secret": "MySecRet....",
    "scopes": [
        "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets",
        "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive"
    ],
    "expiry": "1070-01-01T00:00:00.000001Z"
}
gc, authorized_user = gspread.oauth_from_dict(credentials, authorized_user)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Worksheet Selection and Management
DESCRIPTION: Different methods to select, create, and delete worksheets within a spreadsheet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
worksheet = sh.get_worksheet(0)

worksheet = sh.worksheet("January")

worksheet = sh.sheet1

worksheet_list = sh.worksheets()
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
worksheet = sh.add_worksheet(title="A worksheet", rows=100, cols=20)
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh.del_worksheet(worksheet)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Worksheet Operations
DESCRIPTION: Examples of selecting, creating, and deleting worksheets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# Select worksheet by index. Worksheet indexes start from zero
worksheet = sh.get_worksheet(0)

# By title
worksheet = sh.worksheet("January")

# Most common case: Sheet1
worksheet = sh.sheet1

# Get a list of all worksheets
worksheet_list = sh.worksheets()
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
worksheet = sh.add_worksheet(title="A worksheet", rows="100", cols="20")
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh.del_worksheet(worksheet)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authenticating and Using gspread in Google Colaboratory
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to authenticate and use gspread within Google Colaboratory. It uses Google Colab's built-in authentication and the google.auth library to set up credentials for gspread.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/advanced.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from google.colab import auth
auth.authenticate_user()

import gspread
from google.auth import default
creds, _ = default()

gc = gspread.authorize(creds)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authentication Functions in gspread Python Library
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the three main authentication functions available in the gspread library: oauth for OAuth-based authentication, service_account for service account authentication, and authorize for general authorization with credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/api/top-level.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
.. autofunction:: oauth
.. autofunction:: service_account
.. autofunction:: authorize
```

TITLE: Formatting Text Bold in Google Sheets with gspread
DESCRIPTION: Sets the text format of cells A1:B1 to bold using the worksheet.format() method. This demonstrates basic text formatting capabilities in gspread.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
worksheet.format('A1:B1', {'textFormat': {'bold': True}})
```

TITLE: Service Account Authentication from Dictionary in Python using gspread
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to authenticate with a service account by providing credentials as a Python dictionary instead of a file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

credentials = {
    "type": "service_account",
    "project_id": "api-project-XXX",
    "private_key_id": "2cd … ba4",
    "private_key": "-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----\nNrDyLw … jINQh/9\n-----END PRIVATE KEY-----\n",
    "client_email": "473000000000-yoursisdifferent@developer.gserviceaccount.com",
    "client_id": "473 … hd.apps.googleusercontent.com",
    ...
}

gc = gspread.service_account_from_dict(credentials)

sh = gc.open("Example spreadsheet")

print(sh.sheet1.get('A1'))
```

TITLE: Opening Google Spreadsheet in Python
DESCRIPTION: Examples of different methods to open a Google Spreadsheet using gspread, including opening by title, key, or URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/user-guide.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sh = gc.open('My poor gym results')
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sht1 = gc.open_by_key('0BmgG6nO_6dprdS1MN3d3MkdPa142WFRrdnRRUWl1UFE')
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
sht2 = gc.open_by_url('https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Bm...FE&hl')
```

TITLE: Manual Service Account Authentication with Google Auth in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates manual authentication using google.oauth2 credentials for service accounts. It explicitly defines the required scopes and creates the credentials object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from google.oauth2.service_account import Credentials

scopes = [
    'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets',
    'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive'
]

credentials = Credentials.from_service_account_file(
    'path/to/the/downloaded/file.json',
    scopes=scopes
)

gc = gspread.authorize(credentials)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OAuth Authentication with Custom Paths in Python using gspread
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to authenticate using OAuth by specifying custom paths for both the credentials file and the authorized user file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
gc = gspread.oauth(
    credentials_filename='path/to/the/credentials.json',
    authorized_user_filename='path/to/the/authorized_user.json'
)
```

TITLE: Installing gspread with pip
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the gspread library using pip package manager. Requires Python 3+.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
pip install gspread
```

TITLE: Installing gspread package
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the gspread package using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
pip install gspread
```

TITLE: Accessing a Public Spreadsheet with API Key in Python
DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to open a public spreadsheet using an API key. This method only works with public spreadsheets and requires specifying the spreadsheet by key or URL rather than by name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/burnash/gspread/blob/master/docs/oauth2.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import gspread

gc = gspread.api_key("<your newly create key>")

sh = gc.open_by_key("1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms")

print(sh.sheet1.get('A1'))
```

TITLE: Defining API Reference Table of Contents in reStructuredText
DESCRIPTION: This is a reStructuredText (RST) document that defines the structure of the API reference documentation for gspread. It uses the toctree directive to organize documentation into logical sections with a maximum depth of 2 levels.
